#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {
    char c;
    scanf(" %c", &c); // read a single character, skipping whitespace.

    // Step 1: compute next character
    char next_char = c + 1;

    // Step 2: compute second step's result
    int second_result;
    if (next_char == '5' || next_char == '?') {
        second_result = 1;
    } else {
        second_result = 0;
    }

    // Step 3: compute the sum
    long long ans = 0;
    int N = second_result;
    for (int i = 1; i <= N; i++) {
        ans += (long long)i * (N / i) * (N / i + 1) / 2;
        // Need to handle large numbers? But since N is 0 or 1, it's okay.
    }

    printf("%lld\n", ans);

    return 0;
}
